intro: Licania maranhensis, commonly known as the Maranhão licania, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and woody stems. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
